page.description: A SQL::Connection instance represents a potential or active database session.
page.discussion: The SQL::Connection object is the heart of all database activity. Each instance of SQL::Connection represents a potential or active database session. In order to do anything with a SQL database you must first create (or dimension) a variable and associate it with a programming interface (API) and with a vendor syntax ( Oracle, Access, etc.).

section.title: Using the Connection Object
section.description: The following sample script creates a SQL::Connection object and opens a connection to a Microsoft Access database.
section.example: DIM c as SQL::Connection DIM cs as C cs = "{A5API='Access', A5Syntax='Access', FileName='C:\Program Files\a5v6\MDBFiles\Alphasports.mdb', UserName='Admin'}" ? c.Open(cs) = .T.

property.name: CurrentAPI
property.description: Type: C, Mode: R The name of the current application programming interface being used. For example: Access, Oracle, ODBC, MySQL.

property.name: CurrentSyntax
property.description: Type: C, Mode: R The dialect of SQL (and typically the vendor or product) being used to interact with the database.

property.name: IsOpen
property.description:
Type: L
Mode: R
Returns true if the connection is currently open and false if it has not been opened yet or has been closed.

property.name: CallResult
property.description:
Type: "SQL::CallResult"
Mode: R
Returns the results of the last call.

property.name: ResultSet
property.description:
Type: "SQL::ResultSet"
Mode: R
Returns the currently active result set, or an error if there isn't one.

property.name: ConnectionString
property.description:
Type: C
Mode: RW
The current connection string in syntax format. Should be set by ::SetConnectString().

property.name: SchemaCacheEnabled
property.description:
Type: L
Mode: RW
Default = TRUE (.T.). When this property is set to TRUE (.T.), schema objects retrieved (such as SQL::TableInfo) will be cached for the connection (disconnecting and some update functions clear the cache), when false, all objects are not cached and subsequent requests for a schema object will go directly to the database.

property.name: BulkReadEnabled
property.description: Logical BulkReadEnabled property

property.name: BulkWriteEnabled
property.description: Logical BulkWriteEnabled property

property.name: PortableSQLEnabled
property.description:
Type: L,
Mode: RW
Default = FALSE (.F.). When this property is set to true, SQL statements passed to the ApplyData(), Execute(), ToOpenTable(), ToGridComponentDataObject(), ToOpenTable(), ToPropertyArray(), ToString(), ToXML(), and ValidateQuery() methods are checked to see if they are supported Portable SQL Statements and, if so, then translated to native syntax before being processed. Statements that are not supported are passed directly through to the underlying database driver as if PortableSQLEnabled were false.

property.name: LoginTimeout
property.description:
Type: C,
Mode: RW
Timeout values are "Default", "Infinite", or a string containing an integer specifying the timeout in seconds. Must be set prior to opening the connection.

property.name: ConnectionTimeout
property.description:
Type: C,
Mode: RW
Timeout values are "Default", "Infinite", or a string containing an integer specifying the timeout in seconds. Must be set prior to opening the connection.

property.name: QueryTimeout
property.description:
Type: C,
Mode: RW
Timeout values are "Default", "Infinite", or a string containing an integer specifying the timeout in seconds. Must be set prior to executing a query.

methodref.name: Open
methodref.description: Connect to a database. (See help for SetConnectionString for details on constructing a connect string.)

methodref.name: Close
methodref.description: Close a SQL connection.

methodref.name: ClearSchemaCache
methodref.description: Clear any schema data cached by the connection.

methodref.name: ClearPortableSQLCache
methodref.description: Clear any parsed and translated portable SQL statements cached by the connection.

methodref.name: MaskPassword
methodref.description: Changes the characters in a password string so they will not display well. Please Note! This is not a form of encryption!!! The purpose of masking a password is to prevent it from displaying in a readable form. If you choose to embed a password in a script, it is only as secure as your script.

methodref.name: UnmaskPassword
methodref.description: Changes the characters in a password string so they will display clearly after MaskPassword() has been calleed. Please Note! This is not a form of encryption!!! The purpose of masking a password is to prevent it from displaying in a readable form. If you choose to embed a password in a script, it is only as secure as your script.

methodref.name: GeographySupported

methodref.description: Create a crlf() delimited list of installed SQL Application Programming Interfaces.

methodref.name: ListSupportedAPIs

methodref.name: ListAPIsWithCatagories

methodref.name: ListSyntaxes
methodref.description: Create a crlf() delimited list of installed SQL Syntaxes.

methodref.name: ListAutoIncrementImplementations
methodref.description: Create a crlf() delimited list of auto-increment implementations for the current SQL syntax.

methodref.name: ListProcedureLanguages
methodref.description: Create a crlf() delimited list of procedure languages for the current SQL syntax.

methodref.name: ListPortableSQLFunctions
methodref.description:
Create a crlf() delimited list of portable SQL functions.
Within each row, the tab delimited columns are: Name, Prototype, Description, Aggregate=Y/N, Summary=Y/N, Category
If you provide a syntax name, only functions supported by that syntax will be included. If you do not provide a syntax name, all functions will be included.
Note: Geography functions are only supported for some databases.

methodref.name: ListProperties
methodref.description: Create a list of all connection property names and values in the format <name>tab<value>crlf.

methodref.name: GetAdditionalProperties
methodref.description: Create a list of additional (database specific) connection properties as they were entered in the connection string dialog.

methodref.name: SetConnectionString
methodref.description:
Set the connection string with required parameters: The actual values will depend on how you are connecting to your database. The connect string can be in one of two formats:
Format 1 - {name1='value1',name2='value2'...nameN='valueN'} Example: connectstring = "{UserName='Fred',Password='secret'}" myconn.SetConnectionString(connectstring)
Format 2 - name1<tab>value1<crlf> for each entry: Example: connectstring = "UserName" + chr(9) + "Fred" + crlf() connectstring = connectstring + "Password" + chr(9) + "secret" + crlf() myconn.SetConnectionString(connectstring)

methodref.name: SetSyntaxHandlerScript
methodref.description:
Assign a handler script for the connection to override the default behavior of some or all of the event functions below: Note: Syntax generation functions return true if a statement has been created and false if it has not. Examples:
GenerateAddUserStatement as L (UserName as C, Statement BYREF AS C)
GenerateSelectStatement as L (TableInfo as SQL::TableInfo, Statement BYREF AS C)

methodref.name: SelectAfterSupported
methodref.description: Returns true if the syntax and database version passed supports the portable SQL syntax 'SELECT FIRST n AFTER m'. If you do not provide a syntax name, the current syntax is used. If you do not provide a database version, the current version (if specified) is used. If no syntax is assigned yet, the function will return false.

methodref.name: AddEventScript
methodref.description:
Add a connection event script with functions to handle one or more of the following events:
UpdateBegin(Connection as SQL::Connection, RowsExpected as N, BYREF ProgressInterval as N, Cancel BYREF as L) UpdateProgress(Connection as SQL::Connection, RowsUpdated as N, RowsExpected as N, Cancel BYREF as L) UpdateEnd(Connection as SQL::Connection, RowsUpdated as N)

methodref.name: RemoveEventScript
methodref.description: Remove an event script previously added with AddEventScript.

methodref.name: GenerateSelectStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Select statement for the table passed in.

methodref.name: GenerateInsertStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Insert statement for the table passed in. Note: If UseBatchQualifiers is true then field values will be generated as arguments prefaced with 'new.' so a result set can be the source of the data.

methodref.name: GenerateUpdateStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Update statement for the table passed in. Note: If UseBatchQualifiers is true then field values will be generated as arguments prefaced with 'new.' and 'old.' so a result set can be the source of the data.

methodref.name: GenerateDeleteStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Delete statement for the table passed in. Note: If UseBatchQualifiers is true then field values will be generated as arguments prefaced with and 'old.' so a result set can be the source of the data.

methodref.name: GenerateRetrieveRowQuery
methodref.description: Generate a SQL statement to retrieve a specific row for the table passed in. Key columns are generated as arguments. If Rows is greater than 1 then a set of of arguments will be generated for each row in the following format: <first 20 characters of the key column name> + "_" + the row number. For example: CustomerID becomes CustomerID_1, CustomerID_2 and so on. Note: If the table has no primary key, retrieve is meaningless and no string is returned.

methodref.name: GenerateRowQualifiers
methodref.description:
Generate a crlf delimited list of row qualifiers in the format:
<field_name><tab>argument_name<crlf> Note: If the table has no primary key, row qualifiers are meaningless and no qualifiers are returned.

methodref.name: GenerateWhereClause
methodref.description: Generate a SQL WHERE clause for a table, based on the update criteria specified. Note: If UseBatchQualifiers is true then fields will be prefaced with ':old.' so a result set can be the source of the data.

methodref.name: GenerateColumnWhereClause
methodref.description: Generate a SQL WHERE clause for a table column. Note: If UseBatchQualifiers is true then fields will be prefaced with ':old.' so a result set can be the source of the data.

methodref.name: GenerateNativeTypeString
methodref.description: Generate a SQL type string for type passed in using the current syntax. TableInfo is optional, but provides additional information that is useful.

methodref.name: GenerateNativeTableName
methodref.description: Generate a formatted table name suitable for a SQL query in using the current syntax.

methodref.name: GenerateNativeColumnName
methodref.description: Generate a formatted column name suitable for a SQL query in using the current syntax.

methodref.name: GenerateCreateSchemaScript
methodref.description: Generate a SQL script containing CREATE TABLE statements for each of the tables in the schema definition passed in.

methodref.name: GenerateDropSchemaScript
methodref.description: Generate a SQL script containing DROP TABLE statements for each of the tables in the schema definition passed in.

methodref.name: GenerateCreateTableStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL CREATE TABLE statement for the table passed in.

methodref.name: GenerateDropTableStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL DROP TABLE statement for the table passed in.

methodref.name: GenerateCreateDatabaseStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Create Database statement for the table passed in. Note: Not all databases vendors support creating a database through SQL.

methodref.name: GenerateDropDatabaseStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Drop Database statement for the table passed in. Note: Not all database vendors support dropping a database through SQL.

methodref.name: GenerateCreateIndexStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Create Index statement for the table and index passed in.

methodref.name: GenerateDropIndexStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Drop Index statement for the table passed in.

methodref.name: GenerateAddUserStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Add User statement.

methodref.name: GenerateDropUserStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Drop User statement.

methodref.name: GenerateAddUserGroupStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Add User Group statement.

methodref.name: GenerateDropUserGroupStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Drop User Group statement.

methodref.name: GenerateAddUserToGroupStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Add User To Group statement.

methodref.name: GenerateDropUserFromGroupStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Drop User From Group statement.

methodref.name: GenerateGrantAccessStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Grant Access statement.

methodref.name: GenerateRevokeAccessStatement
methodref.description: Generate a SQL Revoke Access statement.

methodref.name: GenerateLastInsertedIdentityStatement

methodref.description: Retrieve the template syntax handler source for creating your own syntax handler.

methodref.description: Retrieve a connection property by name.

methodref.name: GetConnectionString

methodref.name: ShowADONETConnectionStringDialog
methodref.description: Display a dialog to select an ADO.NET provider and format a connection string.

methodref.name: ListADONETProviders
methodref.description: Returns a TAB and CRLF delimited list of providers with display names

methodref.name: ListADONETProviderDataSources
methodref.description: Returns a TAB and CRLF delimited list of data sources for a provider with display names

methodref.name: BeginTransaction
methodref.description: Begin a batch of SQL updates, inserts and/or deletes that need to succeed or fail as a group.

methodref.name: CommitTransaction
methodref.description: Apply a set of changes started with BeginTransaction.

methodref.name: RollBackTransaction
methodref.description: Undo a set of changes started with BeginTransaction, but not yet applied (CommitTransaction hasn't been called).

methodref.name: Execute
methodref.description: Execute a SQL statement on the connection. Note: To execute more than one command in a single call, separate each query with a single line containing only '\' at the beginning.

methodref.name: ExecuteForValue
methodref.description: Execute a SQL statement on the connection and get the first column of the first row of the result.

methodref.name: ValidateQuery
methodref.description: Validate a SQL query on the connection.

methodref.name: AffectedRows
methodref.description: Return affected rows.

methodref.name: FreeResult
methodref.description: Release the result set from the last SQL select statement. Note: Calling FreeResult is not generally necessary. Call it to free resources when there will be a delay between queries.

methodref.name: ToOpenTable
methodref.description: Fetch data to an open .DBF table using a SQL query Note: The column types returned for each column by the query must match the respective column in the local table.

methodref.name: ToDBF
methodref.description: Fetch data to a local .DBF table using a SQL query

methodref.name: ToString
methodref.description: Fetch data to a string using a SQL query.

methodref.name: ToFormattedString
methodref.description: Fetch data to a string using a SQL query.

methodref.name: ToJSON
methodref.description: Fetch data to an JSON formatted string using a SQL query.

methodref.name: ToJSONObjectSyntax
methodref.description: Fetch data to JSON object syntax using a SQL query.

methodref.name: ToJSONFile
methodref.description: Fetch data to JSON object syntax using a SQL query.

methodref.name: ToCSV
methodref.description: Fetch data to Comma Separated Variable format.

methodref.name: ToXML
methodref.description: Fetch data to an XML formatted string using a SQL query.

methodref.name: ToExcel
methodref.description: Fetch data to an Excel 2003 xls file using a SQL query.

methodref.name: ToPropertyArray
methodref.description: Fetch data to a property array using a SQL query. Note: You must dim the array first: DIM MyArray[1] as P

methodref.name: ToGridComponentDataObject
methodref.description: Fetch data to a Grid Component Data Object using a SQL Query. Note: You must dim the arrays first: DIM MyArray[1] as P

methodref.name: InsertData
methodref.description: Apply new rows to a table in the currently connected database using a result set.

methodref.name: UpdateData
methodref.description: Apply changes to existing rows in a table in the currently connected database using a result set.

methodref.name: DeleteData
methodref.description: Delete rows from a table in the currently connected database using a result set.

methodref.description: Apply the query to a table in the currently connected database using the result set provided.

methodref.name: ApplyCurrentRow
methodref.description: Apply the query to a table in the currently connected database using the current row of the result set provided.

methodref.name: ResultSetFromDBF
methodref.description: Create a SQL::ResultSet object for a table. This object can be passed to SQL update functions. Note: Use of the ParentTable, ADBPath and AbsolutePositioning arguments is an advanced user feature and requires some understanding of caching for SQL.

methodref.name: ResultSetFromADORecordSet
methodref.description: Create a SQL::ResultSet object for an ADODB RecordSet.

methodref.name: CreateDatabase
methodref.description: Create a new database.

methodref.name: DropDatabase
methodref.description: Remove a database.

methodref.name: CreateSchemaTables
methodref.description: Create all tables in the schema in the currently connected database using the TableInfo specifications in the schema.

methodref.name: DropSchemaTables
methodref.description: Drop all tables defined in the schema from the currently connected database.

methodref.name: CreateTable
methodref.description: Create a table in the currently connected database using the TableInfo specification.

methodref.name: DropTable
methodref.description: Drop a table from the currently connected database.

methodref.name: LastInsertedIdentity
methodref.description: Get the identity value from the last insert for the current session.

methodref.name: CreateIndex
methodref.description: Create an index on the specified table in the currently connected database using the TableInfo and IndexInfo specifications.

methodref.name: DropIndex
methodref.description: Drop the index named from table specified in the currently connected database.

methodref.name: GetTableInfo
methodref.description: Get the definition of a table.

methodref.name: GetTableInfoFromDBF
methodref.description: Get the definition of a DBF table from an open table or by name.

methodref.name: GetSchema
methodref.description: Get a schema definition.

methodref.name: ListServers
methodref.description: Return a list of servers for the current connection Application Programming Interface(API).

methodref.name: GetPreferredSyntax
methodref.description: Return a the most appropriate syntax for the server specified or an empty string if not known.

methodref.name: ListDatabases
methodref.description: Return a list of databases from the current server.

methodref.name: ListTables
methodref.description:
Return a list of tables for the current database.
Example Usage:
dim Filter as SQL::TableFilter Filter.IncludeViews = .t. Connection.ListTables(Filter)
Note: The overload below is still allowed, but is obsolute. Use a TableFilter argument instead.
C ListTables( [IncludeTables as L [, IncludeViews as L [, IncludeLinkedTables as L [, IncludeSystemTables as L [, IncludeSynonyms as L [, IncludeAliases as L]]]]]])

methodref.name: ListTablesWithTypes
methodref.description:
Return a list of tables for the current database suffixed with (<type>).
Example Usage:
dim Filter as SQL::TableFilter Filter.IncludeViews = .t. Connection.ListTables(Filter)
Note: The overload below is still allowed, but is obsolute. Use a TableFilter argument instead.
C ListTablesWithTypes( [IncludeTables as L [, IncludeViews as L [, IncludeLinkedTables as L [, IncludeSystemTables as L [, IncludeSynonyms as L [, IncludeAliases as L]]]]]])

methodref.name: PrimaryKeyExpression
methodref.description: Return the primary key expression for a Table.

methodref.name: AddUser

methodref.name: DropUser
methodref.description: Remove the user named from the currently connected database or server.

methodref.name: AddUserGroup
methodref.description: Create a new user group in the currently connected database or server.

methodref.name: DropUserGroup
methodref.description: Remove the user group named from the currently connected database or server.

methodref.name: AddUserToGroup

methodref.name: DropUserFromGroup
